description: The coconut  milk tea with some pineapple and lychee jelly in it was so slimy and satisfying, however the mango cream of other products containing it were bit too thick and heavy for my somehow pepper-proof but otherwise whiny&fragile stomach.
author: Lulu Y.

description:
Happened upon this little place during our walk from China town. Nice staff. Tasty drinks. Tried the taro boba with clear tapioca and paid another $0.50/$0.75 (can't remember which amount)
for a cute little reusable bottle. Will have to check out the location on Geary (closer to son's school) to get another drink and reusable bottle.
author: R L.

description:
Got the coconut mango sago which apparently isn't on the menu anymore but when you order it they'll still make it for you. The drink was yummy. It had lychee, a mango mix, coconut milk, and sago. I wish they would have put more sago but i was still satisfied with the drink I got. 

I also opted for the cute little plastic bottle which was something new because they discontinued the glass bottles due to hazard issues from small children dropping and breaking the bottles.
author: Madelynn A.

description: I came here for the first time after seeing the boba place next door was closed. I ordered the Winnie the Pooh drink and it was quite good. I liked that they had real mango pieces in it and after mixing the top (strawberry green tea) with the sweeter mango juice on the bottom, was delicious!
author: Helen z.

description:
I'm not a typical complaining person. Here we go. A mosquito was floating. 

DID YOU GUYS CLEAN YOUR TEA POTS?

Mosquitoes drink my blood. Now I drink mosquito...
author: Annie Y.

description:
E Tea was, well, not really tea. While this locations serves as a teahouse, serving tea and food, this review is solely on the drinks. Yes, the sizes are large, and what? You can't get a smaller size? Okay fine, so I'll have a little more tea than usual then. 

I really hope it was an off day when I got my thai tea because I should've just gotten a water cup instead. Right, my tea tasted extremely watered down. I was essentially drinking water with a tiny dab of tea. My friend seemed to fare much better with his drink though, now I wish I asked him what he had got.

Well, at the very least, if I ever find myself here ago, I know not to get thai tea. I'm sure everything else is much better than what I got.
author: Derek T.

description: I like the flavors they have here, I got a mango green tea drinks because that's one of my favorite flavors and it was delicious. Their cow logo is so cute and they have tall skinny cups. You can also buy your drink in a plastic sealable reusable bottle. They used to have glass ones (which I was able to get before) but now it's plastic. I would definitely try their other flavors because there's so many to try! Also I don't get boba/pearls/tapioca balls so I don't have any judgments toward it.
author: Romyn S.

description:
Not bad but not impressive.

I ordered the Sa Wa Di Ka (thai tea) drink and I like that it comes in a glass jar - similar to Plentea's glass jars.
author: Mabel Y.

description: This special order, hot coffee Milk tea, is not on the menu. Our friend warned us e cafe is not as sweet as other boba place. So we both go with 50% sugar, which is good. However, as a milk tea, I was disappointed. I may not come back unless feel chilly again while waiting for Dragon Beaux....
author: Silvia L.

description: Ehhh... I've had better boba. I ordered a strawberry green tea, but didn't taste the tea. It was more like water with strawberry syrup and boba. I probably won't be back but my philosphy is "don't knock it till you try it!".
author: Katie W.

description: I was looking through my box of items from my San Fran and found a business card for this place and a bubble tea pic from my bestie and I. We did save the receipt although faded now but it does show that we ordered a mango bubble tea. Instead we had jellies instead of pearls. It was close to what we have here. It was really hot, therefore, I remember just needing something to chill from the coolness.
author: Shila B.

description:
First time here. New to me teas. We came here with family that goes here a lot. We had the tea float with boba. I had never heard of boba before, little round black jelly balls. It was very good. Lots of choices.

I liked it! Will have to try more.
author: Diane G.

description: Flavorwise this tea is pretty good and the boba is the perfect size and texture. The bobas are slightly smaller than the usual ones I've had but are very chewy and not gooey. However the menu marketed the drinks as Yakut based drinks but it tastes like regular yogurt syrup. It still tasted good but not what it advertised. Winnie the Pooh was a very cool drink with three different kinds of flavor within one drink and is very unique. I love the size of the cups because they fit in all cup holders even the especially small ones.
author: Ellen G.

description:
E Tea.
I spent forever believing this was a nerdy joke on E and Z isomers in organic chemistry...
Then realized it's a pun on ET. /facepalm

TL;DR - A millennial's i.e. my thought process: Ooo a new place with cute glass bottles! -Goes without finding out whether the tea is good- -And the tea turns out to be good- -And it all costs less than toast- Happiness.

Cynicisms aside, E Tea is among my more preferred tea shops in SF:
- The tea quality is good
- Their flavorings don't taste very artificial, and they have an option of real fruit as a topping (a healthy alternative to boba and it looks Instagram-worthy)
- The menu also features a tasty array of favorites like sesame, almond, taro, matcha, mango sago, and a creama series
- Friendly service and upbeat atmosphere
- The area is small with one table near the counter, but they share a space with Super Pan and I think you can sit inside as well (plus Super Pan is super tasty)
author: Edna C.

description:
We came here after eating dinner at San Tungs with high hopes as it has high reviews on Yelp. Yet, another hype. Another disappointment. Even the ABG in our group shook her head to this boba joint. When an ABG says it's not good, you know it's not good. 

Regular Milk Tea with boba (number 1): Straight up tasted like chocolate milk tea. I can even taste the undiluted powder. 

Despite the cute jug cups you get to keep, I'd have to say this is an overall pass. Just drive an extra minute to Bubblecup.
author: Vivian C.

description:
1. AC not that strong here
2. The drinks come in glass bottles
3. Tea is just decent not amazing
4. The place is a quick grab and go
5. Slightly pricey for the area
6. I would come again when in the area
author: Bruce S.

description:
The fat chick in me wishes this place was more accessible. 

They have so many flavors to choose from and that fried chicken though... (need I say more?)

Sadly, I wouldn't have been able to handle a third lunch, so decided on the black sesame bubble tea. It was SO SO delicious, I should have ordered one to go. The little cow logo is just adorable!

I can't wait to come back and try other flavors.
author: Shereen A.

description:
They have lavender MT yay! So already they'll get stars just for it haha

I think their lavender it is lavender tea and it can come with creama aka fresh milk and the drink was right around $5 - I don't remember too much about it because it was some time ago but I would say this satisfies a craving if you're in the area but there's nothing special about it. The lavender is more on the subtle side.

What surprised me is the sizes - the plastic cups it comes in is 24oz but the glass bottles they offer are expensive but less oz, which means you pay more for less oz but you get to keep the bottle haha

50/50 coming back - there's also an off smell because it's shared with the restaurant, I recommend just getting the drink to go versus dining in
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Disclaimer: totally biased by the cute cow glass bottle

Green Tea + mango was refreshing and just the pick me up I needed

Overall Thoughts

Well worth it if you are into collecting cute novelty trinkets while sipping on boba teas
author: Eddie W.

description: Awesome cool employees. Great tastes for great prices. Only boba location I come too in SF. Even if they're closed I still stay faithful and don't go anywhere else. E-Tea is the bomb diggity!!!
author: Jake T.

description:
"Always full of yummy smiles."

What does that even mean? Are there "yummy smiles" in the drinks? Is the restaurant full of people who are smiling because the food is yummy? What even is a "yummy smile"? And also, what does E-Tea stand for? These are the important questions.

Unfortunately, I have no answers. I attempted to find out what E-Tea stands for-- the girl at the register told me that it may be a play on the owner's name (Eddie) or it may be a reference to E.T. (the movie), but that this is also her own personal speculation.

But anyway... to what actually matters in this review:
Whenever I go to a new boba/pmt place, I always try the standard milk tea. The jasmine green milk tea here was decent-- not the best I've ever had, but not terrible either. I thought this was just my perception, but then I saw that another Yelper had mentioned this as well-- I felt like the sugar used in the drink tasted a bit like a sugar substitute instead of real sugar. 

The boba/pearls themselves were also decent. They were the right amount of chewiness, so no complaints here.

The Pooh Bear drink is adorable to look at-- before it's mixed, there's a layer of red on top of the layer of yellow, just like good ol' Pooh Bear. 

Random: Some advice from my E-Tea drink cup: Enjoy Tea. Enjoy Life. Enjoy E-tea in your life.

tl;dr: Not the best milk tea I've ever had, but certainly not the worst. I don't know that I'd go out of my way to come here, but if I'm ever in the area, I could see myself stopping by. (Although there is also a TeaOne literally three doors down...)
author: Lillian Z.

description:
Please put more than one employee on shift. Long line long wait. Don't come here.

Better options in the area.
author: Mario D.

description:
They are super yummy and very helpful. I highly recommend. Great customer service
I got the honeydew slush with boba.
They have strawberry exploding boba and regular boba.

Very nice girls too.
author: Kayla C.

description:
Ordered:
- lavender milk tea 24 oz $4
- earl grey black tea + milk $5.25
- coconut taro sago 20oz $4.50
- karaage fried chicken $7

Pros:
- Cute design that looked very similar to BB Tea's cow design..
- The presentation made the drinks look appealing 

Cons:
- Lavender Milk Tea tasted really bitter than what I'm used to. 
- Earl Grey Milk Tea had no taste of the earl grey.. instead it tasted like regular milk tea. I asked to add in milk but they just put a cream foam on top. 
- Coconut Taro Sago didn't really taste what it described... it just tastes like whipped cream with sago. 
- Karaage Fried Chicken were small chunks of chicken that was not worth the price. You can get the same amount of chicken for $4-5. It was pretty sweet too. Not really a salty treat with the milk tea. 

Overall, I was disappointed in this experience and should have went to Tea One - which is two stores away.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I've only been here once but the encounter was so bizarre I'm not sure I want to go back. Here's a transcript of my exchange with the girl at the register:

Me: Can I get the matcha with red beans and jelly.
Girl: You want bottle or cup?
Me: Why is the bottle more expensive than the cup even though it's 4 oz smaller?
Girl: Because it's a bottle...?
Me: Right. But the point is that the bottle is smaller.
Girl: Yes.
Me: ...
Girl: ...?
Me: Whatever. I'll just get the cup then.
Girl: So you don't want the red beans and jelly?
Me: What? Wait, does the cup not come with red beans and jelly?
Girl: ...
Me: Just get me a bottle.

I'm still not sure exactly what's the difference between the bottle and the cup. The tea was alright though.
author: Carl W.

description:
Incredibly disappointed with my visit here today. Since E Tea shares the same storefront as my local-favorite, Super Pan, I had high hopes for their teas. I ordered the house black tea with milk and no boba for a friend and the mango slushie for myself.

At $4.50 for a pretty large size, it was a ok deal, but we really just wanted a regular 12oz cup so at least give us an option to go small! Service was mediocre -- points off because we got the mango slush a full 10 mins after we got the milk tea. They also mistakenly added boba but I think we can all overlook that because boba tea is called boba tea for a reason. On top of that, the lid wasnt sealed very well, causing the drink to leak out. 

The taste was not worth $4.50. The milk tea tasted watered down and the mango chunks they put into the slushie was very sour. Tastes like how I would imagine cold mango-flavored syrup withsmall pieces or unripe mango cubes. I would price that at most at $3.00 flat. Wasn't worth the trip, we both didn't finish the massive starbucks venti-size cups of goop. I won't be back.
author: Nat E.

description: I've been wanting to try E Tea, mostly because of the glass bottles. I always wondered what the E stands for and found out from one of the staff that the owner owns another place that starts with E so this place is called E Tea. Anyway, the tea is decent. I enjoyed the matcha with boba more, it was pretty good and creamy. The Jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly was okay, but it was a bit on the bitter side even with 100% sweetness. I'm not sure if they owned the Super Pan restaurant that's connected also?
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
We almost missed this little store as we walked on the opposite side of geary. Unlike the neighboring out of business teaone & infinitea its small, doesn't have this massive sign, and is obscured by trees.
Anyway we found it, and while we were trying to pick from the large menu, we let a large group pass us in line, but they served really quickly and we ordered and received our drink in no time.

We ordered the mango sago with lychee jelly and honey boba. Upon receiving our drink we realized we should've asked to subtract the lychee, which came with the drink, toppings climbed up a little over half the cup.
However the texture of the drink was good, it was around the consistency of a milk tea which i much prefer to a texture of a slush. The flavor wasn't bad either and it tasted pretty fresh. I don't know if i will come back but it certainly wasn't bad.

[we did a boba run through the richmond on 7.7.18. here are the results and rankings for e tea]

all the following categories (boba texture/freshness/flavor) are scored out of five and their position in to the seven total places we visited is listed also
person a 2/4/3/9 #5
person b 3/4/4/11 #3
person c 4/3/5/12 #2
person d 2/4/4/10 #6
author: Boba R.

description: The fruit teas are the bomb and combined with the rainbow jelly! I always pair their drinks with either chicken kaarage or takoyaki... ok last option would be Curry fish balls. The food are perfect to pair with milk tea/fruit teas. I guess it makes sense cos they're holding on and the boba place a door down is out of business!
author: Jaide F.

description:
I mainly went here for the reusable glass cow bottle and finally made it down to this side of town. Easy to find and inside it was right in front of me and to the left was the Super Pan restaurant which looked pretty full to me at around 5:45pm. Brightly lit
Menu board and a giant poster listing the menu in case the bright board hurts your eyes probably. LOL 

I like how they have printed out color menu that I can take away from both e tea and the super pan, so I can plan what to order next time. 

I was the only one there and decided to go with #6 $4.50, the Almond Queen which has Almond &Taro milk tea with taro chunks and pudding. They were pretty quick in making my drink under 5 minutes.  

I was happy with the glass cow and drink where I can see the big white pudding that looks like tofu and tiny chunks of mashed up taro. I think there was more pudding than taro chunks. The presentation was pretty. I was holding the precious bottle like it was a treasure. I took my drink home. The only thing I didn't like was when the foam of drink settled in, I had a like inch of space on top. It wold have been nice if there was more drink on top.  The flavoring was very light.  Upon first sip it was sweet. After that it was okay and mellow drinking. 

I kind of would like to return to give the place another chance. I probably need to try something with stronger flavor with no boba balls, but not sure which one. Hmmm...if anyone has suggestions, send me a message! :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description: The boba pearls are excellent - maybe a tad mushy for others, but not a hard one in the bunch! I got the jasmine green milk tea with 25% sugar, and it wasn't sweet at all. It was pretty bitter, actually, in that tea bitter sort of way, and I didn't find it milky. Later on, I guess the sugar settled so it was more sweet and the weird thing is the cream coagulated and stuck together like foam. It was pretty weird.
author: Ke C.

description:
My new go to because ShareTea now sucks. 

E Tea employees are nice, the drinks are good, and I like the glass jar. I like to bring it back and reuse.. sometimes I forget to bring it back but it's ok, I'm upcycling it at home with my own juices and smoothies. 
My fave is the mango coconut drink here. I think it's the #12 or 13? Anyway, I like E Tea because they have crystal boba too!
author: Susy C.

description:
# 18 E Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 

Geary location in the "Rich" is not my favorite and a bit "milky" to my liking.  It falls at #18 in my rankings (of 30) below.

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.

# 2 Puppy bobar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 8/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars
